definitions.definition: To leave or withdraw from; to quit; to retire from
definitions.example: The firefighters told us to evacuate the area as the flames approached.

definitions.definition: To cause to leave or withdraw from.
definitions.example: The firefighters decided to evacuate all the inhabitants from the street.

definitions.definition: To make empty; to empty out; to remove the contents of, including to create a vacuum.
definitions.example: The scientist evacuated the chamber before filling it with nitrogen.

definitions.definition: To remove; to eject; to void; to discharge, as the contents of a vessel, or of the bowels.
To make void; to nullify; to vacate.
definitions.example: to evacuate a contract or marriage
